item.title: Comet NEOWISE as Seen Around the World
item.description: Comet NEOWISE, on its way to the deep freeze beyond the planets, makes its closest approach to Earth this week, appearing as a large shooting star in the early evening sky near the constellation of the Big Dipper.

item.title: Ethiopian Leader Reports Progress in Talks With Egypt, Sudan Over Nile Dam
item.description: Ethiopia’s prime minister said negotiations with Egypt and Sudan had paved the way for an agreement over the country’s hydroelectric dam on one of the Nile River’s tributaries, in a sign of progress in efforts to end a decadelong dispute over management of the river’s waters.

item.title: U.S. Accuses Two Hackers of Stealing Secrets From U.S. Firms for China
item.description: The two accused hackers also probed the cyber defenses of at least four American companies working on coronavirus treatment and testing in recent months, the indictment alleged.

item.title: How Angela Merkel's Change of Heart Drove Historic EU Rescue Plan
item.description: The German chancellor, swayed from her long opposition to handouts, pushed through the European Union’s agreement to offer €750 billion to help members counter the coronavirus’s economic devastation.

item.title: U.S. Moving Military Assets Around Asia to Counter China, Esper Says
item.description: The U.S. is positioning forces across Asia for a possible confrontation with China, Defense Secretary Mark Esper said in remarks outlining the military component of the Trump administration’s hardening stance toward Beijing.

item.title: Ex-Commander in Argentina's 'Dirty War' Is Living Quietly in Berlin, Prosecutors Say
item.description: A retired Argentine military officer is living in a balconied apartment of a townhouse in a trendy district of Berlin, where neighbors often see him and his wife buying croissants from a downstairs bakery or taking leisurely walks in the nearby park.

item.title: Worst Flooding in Decades Raises Concerns Over China's Three Gorges Dam
item.description: Two months of unusually powerful rains in central and southern China have swelled the Yangtze River, triggering the worst flooding in decades and raising concerns about the Three Gorges Dam, the world’s largest hydroelectric facility.
